content: Yogita Bhayan, founder of Pari, who has been protesting alongside the survivor, says the Supreme Court has restored her faith in the judiciary

content: Traditionally not a communally-sensitive region, Mandya has seen an escalation in communal conflicts in recent times, particularly after the BJP-JD(S) alliance, say observers

content: Meeting reviews NDA government's performance in the year, highlights achievements like welfare outlays exceeding ‚Çπ50,000 crore benefiting various sections, recruitment of 15,941 teachers and 5,757 police personnel, MoUs for ‚Çπ13.25 lakh crore investments and double-digit GDP growth

content: In the video emerging from Kaithal‚Äôs Kalayat, a local man speaking in Haryanvi dialect is heard confronting the vendor sitting on a concrete bench asking him to chant ‚ÄúVande Matram‚Äù

content: They criticise State government for procuring red gram only at MSP fixed by the Centre without providing any additional incentive

content: Party demands ‚Çπ50 lakh assistance to Ramarao‚Äôs family, rectification of plot allotments and fulfilment of assurances to farmers and residents of the capital region

content: The UDF candidates secured nine votes against the LDF‚Äôs eight. Twenty20 which has six members and Social Democratic Party of India which has one member abstained from voting

title: BJP MLA Sharanu Salagar booked for ‚Äòfailure‚Äô to repay loan
content: A complaint has been filed by Sanjukumar Sugure accusing him of failing to repay a loan of ‚Çπ99 lakh taken during the 2023 Assembly elections

title: A.P. Cabinet Sub-Committee reviews litigation policy
content: Panel looks at cutting avoidable cases, strengthening Lok Adalats and improving administrative efficiency

content: The focus will be on ensuring the scientific processing of waste generated in various wards, says chairperson

title: Focus on overcoming hurdles posed by regulations under ‚Äògreen zone‚Äô in Kalamassery, says chairperson Jamal Manakkadan
content: The first meeting of the new council, to be held on January 1, 2026, will discuss measures to overcome hurdles in the construction of new infrastructure projects in the civic body in view of the restrictions imposed under green zone regulations

title: Why only 1.9% ex-servicemen get government jobs against 10%-25% provision, asks Rahul Gandhi
content: When ex-servicemen are referred to private hospitals, they often face major problems in getting treatment and admission, as several hospitals refuse them treatment, citing unpaid government dues, says the LoP.

title: CPI(M) signals an early start for LDF‚Äôs 2026 Assembly campaign
content: Party State secretary says the ruling front will expose the Congress-BJP bid to shift focus away from livelihood and development issues by combating religion and caste-based identity politics stoked by the Congress and BJP¬†

title: Aluva‚Äôs new chairperson prefers realistic approach, says priority is to finish pending works
content: The third-term Congress councillor, who was the deputy chairperson in the previous council, says her priority will be to finish the ongoing development projects, mainly the renovation of the market complex, in a timely manner before making tall promises

title: Fake demands under MGNREGA will not be entertained: Centre
content: Rural Development Ministry officials tell House panel that they are in touch with States to ensure that during the interim period when MGNREGA is phased out and new law is implemented, no ‚Äúfake demand‚Äù is raised

title: NSS aims at taking students from campus to community, says scholar
content: Social science scholar-activist Narendra Badasheshi was speaking after inaugurating NSS activities at Sidhartha Law College in Kalaburagi

title: Tirumala all set for Vaikunta Ekadasi with focus on common devotees
content: TTD suspends paid darshan tickets for the first three days and makes arrangements for 1.76 lakh pilgrims holding Sarva Darshan tokens, with elaborate crowd-management measures in place

content: Organisers describe the response as one of the strongest in recent years, noting a particularly encouraging turnout of young readers

title: Iranna Kadadi meets Om Birla on behalf of Belagavi administration
content: Earlier, a Maharashtra MP complained to the Speaker against the Deputy Commissioner after a prohibitory order was passed against him

title: Free sparsha darshan for Chenchus on Vaikunta Ekadasi in Srisailam
content: Chenchus will be allowed to enter through the queue line at the Old Donation Counter from 11 a.m., says temple management

title: DGP calls for greater awareness among public to prevent cybercrimes like digital arrest
content: Police handled over 62,000 complaints related to cybercrimes and registered 2,332 cases while public lost ‚Çπ815 crore in the offences in 2025, says Harish Kumar Gupta

content: The National Agricultural Development Cooperative Limited, Baramulla, J&K, is coordinating an international conference at UAS in Raichur

title: Sabarimala temple to open for Makaravilakku festival on Tuesday
content: A large influx of devotees, particularly from the neighbouring States, is expected during the period

title: Telugu States bag major share of Vaikuntha Ekadasi darshan tokens at Tirumala
content: With the TTD introducing the e-dip random allotment system for the first time, Andhra Pradesh and Telangana account for most successful applicants, indicating higher awareness of the transparent, system driven process

title: Arrangements in place at temples for festive rush in Chittoor, Anantapur districts
content: Kanipakam temple likely to witness huge devotee rush on Vaikunta Ekadasi (December 30), Vaikunta Dwadasi (December 31) and on New Year (January 1); temple management halts ‚ÄòAntaralaya Darshanams‚Äô for the three days to facilitate darshan to more number of devotees

title: No war in Pawar 'parivar': From split to civic poll pact - the NCP saga explained
content: The Ajit Pawar-led NCP and the Sharad Pawar faction will contest local elections in Pimpri-Chinchwad and Pune together. This alliance is a local arrangement for the civic polls. The decision was made after consulting party workers. This development has raised questions within the Maha Vikas Aghadi alliance.

title: Mumbai: 4 killed, 10 injured as BEST bus hits passengers; driver detained
content: A reversing BEST bus tragically struck pedestrians on Station Road in Bhandup (West) late Monday night, resulting in at least four fatalities and ten injuries. Emergency services responded swiftly, transporting the injured to local hospitals. The exact cause of the devastating accident is currently under investigation.

title: Cargo ship or warship? China's sinister Taiwan war plan revealed - see pics
content: China is transforming its cargo ship, Zhongda 79, into an arsenal ship, equipping it with containerized launchers for up to 60 missiles. This upgrade, featuring advanced weaponry including hypersonic missiles, signifies Beijing's push to bolster its naval capabilities and match the US Navy's vertical launch systems. The vessel's transformation highlights China's growing maritime ambitions.

title: Handshake row deepens; PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi warns of 'equal terms'
content: PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi said Pakistan will not force handshakes with India if the Indian team is unwilling, ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026. He stressed keeping politics out of cricket and demanded equal treatment. The issue has continued since the Pahalgam attack, causing repeated handshake refusals, controversies, ICC interventions and sanctions during recent India-Pakistan tournaments.

title: Nvidia gives an update on the deal seen as ‚Å†a major financial lifeline for Intel
content: Nvidia has invested $5 billion in Intel, acquiring a significant stake. This strategic partnership aims to bolster Intel's struggling market position by leveraging its manufacturing capabilities for custom x86 CPUs and PC chips.  The deal signifies a crucial step in Intel's turnaround, offering much-needed capital and industry validation.

title: ‚ÄòAI agents are becoming a problem‚Äô: OpenAI CEO flags risks; offers $555K role
content: OpenAI is hiring a high-paid Head of Preparedness amid growing fears of AI systems exploiting security flaws and harming mental well-being. CEO Sam Altman acknowledged models are finding critical vulnerabilities, while also highlighting AI's potential psychological impact. The role will tackle cybersecurity, biosecurity, and self-improving AI risks, a crucial step as AI's dual nature becomes apparent.

title: 'We're worried': What SC said on convict Sengar's bail; the 'public servant' question
content: The Supreme Court has intervened in the Unnao rape case. It has halted the Delhi high court's decision to suspend former BJP leader Kuldeep Singh Sengar's life sentence. The apex court is examining if an MLA qualifies as a public servant under the POCSO Act. This move ensures Sengar remains in jail. The survivor welcomes the Supreme Court's action.

title: Chinese billionaire‚Äôs plan: Gaming tycoon fathered 100 children
content: Chinese billionaire Xu Bo reportedly aims to father at least 20 US-born children via surrogacy to inherit his $1.1 billion gaming fortune. While his company denies claims of over 100 children, they confirmed 12 were born in the US. This trend echoes similar desires from figures like Pavel Durov and Elon Musk to expand their legacies.

title: Scientists found more than 16,000 dinosaur footprints underwater in Bolivia
content: A remarkable discovery in Bolivia's Torotoro National Park has revealed over 16,000 dinosaur footprints. These ancient tracks, dating back 68 million years, show dinosaurs moving along a prehistoric lake's edge. Researchers believe some dinosaurs may have even waded or swum in shallow waters. This site offers unique insights into dinosaur behaviour and their interaction with aquatic environments.

title: AI is not therapy: Microsoft AI CEO defends use; says chatbots can spread kindness
content: Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman observes a growing trend of users confiding personal issues, like relationship troubles, in AI chatbots, finding them non-judgmental and supportive. While acknowledging potential dependency risks, he believes these tools can foster kindness.

title: Travis Kelce admits he let Andy Reid down amid Chiefs‚Äô tough season
content: Kansas City Chiefs fans experienced an unfamiliar season of losses and missed playoffs in 2025, a stark contrast to years of dominance.  Veteran Travis Kelce expressed deep disappointment, feeling he let down coach Andy Reid, highlighting their strong bond and his unwavering sense of responsibility to the team and his mentor.

title: Tim Dillon questions Erika Kirk‚Äôs public appearances after Charlie Kirk tragedy
content: Tim Dillon questioned Erika Kirk‚Äôs public appearances after reports about Charlie Kirk, saying people feel confused. On his podcast, he discussed her merch events and her interview with Nicki Minaj at America Fest. Erika Kirk defended her actions, continued leading Turning Point USA, and reassured Minaj during their on-stage conversation.

title: MLB trade rumors: Mets eye $10M Phillies star; Brandon Nimmo in focus
content: The New York Mets are reportedly signing veteran outfielder Max Kepler to a one-year deal, aiming for a cost-effective solution after trading Brandon Nimmo. Kepler offers defensive reliability and left-handed power, fitting the Mets' strategy of maintaining roster stability and payroll flexibility while preparing for top prospect Carson Benge's eventual rise.

title: A dead man's archive: What the Epstein files unleashed in 2025
content: What was meant to close the book instead exposed how deeply Epstein‚Äôs world had been protected, how many powerful people passed through it, and how difficult it is to tell the truth once secrecy has been institutionalised.

title: Kaun Banega Crorepati 17: Kumar Birla recalls his father's tough condition
content: Kumar Mangalam Birla revealed on Kaun Banega Crorepati that his father, Aditya Vikram Birla, mandated he become a Chartered Accountant before joining the family business. Despite his initial desire to pursue an MBA, Birla ultimately complied with his father's strict rule, even after seeking help from his grandfather and mother.

title: Watch: Carlsen loses cool; slams table again after loss to India‚Äôs Erigaisi
content: World No. 1 Magnus Carlsen slammed the table after losing on time to India‚Äôs Arjun Erigaisi at the World Blitz Championship in Doha. The ninth-round defeat, with Arjun playing black, was one of the tournament‚Äôs biggest upsets and pushed him joint top on 7.5 points. It was Carlsen‚Äôs latest emotional outburst.

title: The Designer of the Year Award goes to... AI
content: That moment reshaped the industry. If neural networks could see, what else could they learn? The answer, as Jensen Huang would later discover, was nearly everything.

title: When should you sell a stock? How to remove emotions from investment - explained
content: Selling stocks will never become effortless. There will always be some doubt, some second-guessing. That‚Äôs normal. The goal is not to get every sell decision perfectly right. The goal is to avoid selling good businesses for bad reasons.

title: Who was Erica Fox? Missing swimmer identified after body found off California coast
content: A body found near Davenport Beach has been identified as missing swimmer Erica Fox, 55. She vanished on December 21 while swimming near Lovers Point in Pacific Grove. Family confirmed her identity after the recovery on December 27. Authorities continue to investigate, following reports of a shark sighting at the time she disappeared.

title: Aravalli, stray dogs & fireworks: 2025 was a year of flip flops in SC
content: The Supreme Court has witnessed a concerning trend of overturning its own recent orders, including those on the Aravali controversy, stray dogs, and firecrackers. This judicial flip-flopping, noted by the court itself, risks undermining its credibility and public confidence. The trend suggests decisions may be made hastily, prioritizing judges over established legal principles.

title: Kishan, Pant or Jurel: Who will be KL Rahul‚Äôs backup for NZ ODIs
content: With KL Rahul set to be India‚Äôs first-choice wicketkeeper, the battle for his backup has intensified ahead of the New Zealand ODIs. Ishan Kishan‚Äôs red-hot domestic form, Rishabh Pant‚Äôs experience and Dhruv Jurel‚Äôs consistency have turned the second wicketkeeper‚Äôs slot into a key selection dilemma as India fine-tune their white-ball plans

title: Missiles & loiter munition: Centre clears mega Rs 79K cr defence deal; what's on list
content: The Defence Acquisition Council has approved capital acquisition proposals totaling approximately Rs 79,000 crore to enhance the operational capabilities of the Armed Forces. These approvals, granted on December 29, 2025, cover a variety of equipment for the Army, Navy, and Air Force, including loiter munition systems, radars, guided rocket ammunition, and drone detection systems.

title: ‚ÄòMy hero‚Äô: Bryce Dunlap‚Äôs liver donation sparks rare Browns captain moment
content: The Cleveland Browns honored Kimberly Dunlap Kane as Dawg Pound Captain before their Week 17 game against the Steelers. Her son, Bryce Dunlap, donated his liver to Browns legend Bernie Kosar in a life-saving transplant. Kosar shared an emotional message as Cleveland centered its final home game around gratitude, organ donation, and Bryce‚Äôs legacy.

title: Protect your heart during winter with 5 simple daily habits
content: Winter's chill silently strains your heart.  Cold weather constricts blood vessels, raises blood pressure, and thickens blood, increasing cardiac workload.  Combined with reduced activity and unhealthy eating habits, this season poses a significant risk.  Simple daily practices like staying active, keeping warm, eating well, staying hydrated, and maintaining a consistent sleep schedule can effectively protect your cardiovascular health.

title: Horrific car accident: Anthony Joshua hospitalised; all you need to know
content: Former world heavyweight champion Anthony Joshua was injured in a car accident in Nigeria that killed two other passengers. The crash, confirmed by Lagos officials, occurred on a busy road linking Ogun State and Lagos. Joshua was taken to an undisclosed hospital, with no details yet on his injuries. The accident comes just days after his win over Jake Paul in Miami, as he prepares for a potential title return and a possible fight with Tyson Fury in 2026.

title: Live-fire war games: China launches drills around Taiwan; Taipei mobilises forces
content: China launched large-scale live-fire military drills around Taiwan, deploying warships and aircraft in a stern warning to independence supporters and foreign powers. Taiwan's military is on high alert, vowing to defend its democracy amid drills aimed at blockading key ports and simulating strikes.

title: 'Abysmal record': India flays Pak over attacks on minorities; refutes charges
content: Ministry of external affairs has rejected Pakistan's accusations of attacks on minorities, labeling them as "finger pointing" and highlighting Pakistan's "abysmal record" on the issue. The MEA stated that Pakistan's "horrific and systemic victimisation of minorities" is a well-established fact, refuting claims made by Pakistan's foreign affairs spokesperson.

title: Quote of the day by Arianna Huffington: We need to accept we won‚Äôt‚Ä¶
content: Arianna Huffington, a prominent thought leader, advocates for a redefined understanding of success, health, and leadership. She emphasizes that failure is not the opposite of success but an integral part of the journey, fostering resilience and wisdom. Her insights encourage embracing human limitations and learning from mistakes for comprehensive growth and progress.

title: Unnao rape case: SC warns against political motives; adds judges 'not sitting in ivory towers‚Äô
content: The Supreme Court has halted the Delhi High Court's decision to suspend Kuldeep Singh Sengar's life sentence in the Unnao rape case. Judges acknowledged efforts to exploit the situation for political gain. Sengar remains in jail due to a separate custodial death sentence. The survivor expressed happiness and vowed to pursue the death penalty.

title: 'More autographs than runs' - Aus opener's self-deprecating post goes viral
content: Australian opener Jake Weatherald humorously acknowledged his tough Ashes form with a self-deprecating social media post after the MCG Test concluded swiftly.  Despite scoring low, his positive attitude earned fan support.  The ICC deemed the pitch "unsatisfactory" as Australia secured the Ashes urn ahead of the Sydney finale.

title: World champ at 7; 'nervous' while meeting PM Modi: How Pragnika became chess prodigy
content: Seven-year-old Pragnika Vaka Lakshmi, Under-7 Girls champion at the FIDE World Schools Chess Championship 2025, met PM Narendra Modi after winning gold for India on Friday. From learning chess during COVID to rapid success, she shows rare courage and discipline. Backed by family sacrifices, scholarships, and offline coaching, she balances school, training, and dreams of becoming the best chess player worldwide.

title: Suriname stabbing: Suspect dies by suicide in custody; had killed 9 people including children
content: A man suspected of a horrific knife attack that claimed nine lives, including five children, in Suriname has died by suicide in police custody. The 43-year-old was found hanged in his cell. The violence, which reportedly followed a domestic dispute, has deeply shocked the nation, prompting a message of solidarity from the President.

title: Top 5 NBA career earners: LeBron James, Stephen Curry & more
content: The NBA's highest earners are leveraging talent, health, and strategic contract negotiations to amass fortunes. LeBron James leads with $581 million, followed by Stephen Curry ($532 million), Devin Booker ($520 million), Paul George ($516 million), and Anthony Davis ($511 million). These players demonstrate how modern contracts and business acumen have redefined success in the league.

title: Persistent bad breath could be a warning sign of colon cancer: Experts explains
content: Emerging studies reveal a concerning link between persistent bad breath and colon cancer. Gastroenterologist Dr. Joseph Salhab highlighted that the bacteria Fusobacterium nucleatum, found in the mouth, has been discovered in colon cancer tumors. This bacteria can travel to the intestines, promoting cancer cell growth and spread, suggesting oral hygiene is crucial for gut health.

title: 'Stand committed': Forest min reacts to SC Aravalli ruling; what he said on mining
content: Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav welcomed the Supreme Court's decision to stay its order on the Aravalli range's "new definition." The court has formed a committee to re-examine the issues. The government remains committed to protecting and restoring the Aravalli hills, with mining bans on new and renewed leases continuing. This follows widespread criticism of the previous definition.

title: Don‚Äôt go to Harvard for STEM: Malcolm Gladwell‚Äôs warning explained
content: Gladwell's ‚Äúdon‚Äôt go to Harvard for STEM‚Äù line is less a rule than a reminder about fit. In cohorts, even capable students can start feeling behind, and that feeling can push them out of science. Today, a degree is only the starting point; projects, research and skills matter just as much. Choose an environment that supports you while you grow.

title: OTD: Gavaskar's 236* ‚Äî a day after overtaking Bradman ‚Äî rewrote Indian Test history
content: On this day in 1983, batting legend Sunil Gavaskar etched his name in history with a monumental 236 not out against the West Indies in Chennai. This stellar innings followed his record-breaking 30th Test century, surpassing Don Bradman's long-standing mark. Gavaskar's unbeaten 236 remained India's highest Test score for nearly two decades, a testament to his enduring brilliance.

title: JDS MLA HD Revanna Discharged In Sexual Harassment Case
content: A court here on Monday discharged senior JD(S) MLA and former minister HD Revanna from a sexual harassment case registered in 2024.

title: 4 Dead, 9 Injured After Mumbai's BEST Bus Crashes Into Pedestrians
content: Four people were killed after they were hit by a BEST bus while it was reversing in Mumbai tonight. Nine others were injured. The incident happened in Mumbai's Bhandup.

title: Mumbai Civic Body Polls: BJP To Contest 137 Seats, Shiv Sena 90
content: Ruling allies BJP and Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena will contest 137 and 90 seats, respectively, in the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation polls.

title: Drunk Cab Driver Rams Dozen Vehicles In Gurugram, Arrested
content: Police here detained a cab driver, who allegedly caused widespread panic near Sector 4 market area after he struck more than a dozen vehicles, police said.

title: 2 Arrested In Gujarat For Duping Woman Of Rs 1.9 Crore In Digital Arrest
content: Police on Monday arrested two persons from Gujarat in connection with a 'digital arrest' cyber fraud case in which a woman here was duped of Rs 1.95 crore.

title: Delhi Records Worst Average AQI For December In 7 Years At 349
content: Delhi recorded its worst air quality for December this year since 2018 with an average AQI of 349, even as farm fires accounted for just 3.5 per cent of the PM2.5 pollution, according to official data.

title: When Congress Leader Gaurav Gogoi Was Asked To "Show Passport" In Agra
content: Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi on Monday condemned the brutal killing of Angel Chakma, a student from Tripura, in Dehradun, highlighting the discrimination faced by people from India's Northeast region.

title: Russia Claims Ukraine Fired Drones At Putin's Home, "Lies," Says Zelensky
content: Russia's foreign minister, Sergei Lavrov, on Monday alleged that Ukraine carried out a drone attack overnight on President Vladimir Putin's residence between Moscow and Saint Petersburg.

title: Red Alert In Delhi Over Dense Fog, Air Quality Returns To "Severe"
content: Dense fog blanketed Delhi on Monday, causing visibility to drop sharply in several areas, disrupting operations at the airport and pushing the air quality back into the "severe" category.

title: Fire Breaks Out At JCB Workshop In Jaipur, No Injuries
content: A massive fire broke out at a workshop of JCB company's dealer on Ajmer Road in Jaipur on Monday evening, police said, adding that there was no casualty in the incident.

title: Video: Tiger Attacks Man In Village Near Bandhavgarh Reserve, Then Sits On Cot
content: A tiger entered a village located in the periphery of the Bandhavgarh Tiger Reserve in Madhya Pradesh on Monday, attacked a man, and later sat on a cot inside a house, forcing residents to flee to the rooftop.

title: Mumbai Police Seized Drugs Worth A Massive Rs 814 Crore This Year
content: The Mumbai Police's crackdown on the drugs trade this year has broken the back of the mafia. Police data shows that between January 1 and December 21, 2025, narcotics worth more than Rs 814.17 crore have been seized from across the city.

title: 3 More Districts Come Under VPN Ban in Jammu and Kashmir
content: The authorities in Jammu and Kashmir have intensified their crackdown on the use of Virtual Private Network or VPN. Citing misuse of VPN services and threat to national security, a ban on VPN has been extended to three more districts.

title: Jagannath, Durga, Mahakal: BJP Fumes Over Mamata Banerjee's Temple Projects
content: Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee announced today that Salt Lake, near Kolkata, will host the world's largest Durga Angan -- a gesture to highlight the UNESCO's "cultural heritage" tag for Durga Puja.

title: IndiGo Raises Pilot Pay Weeks After Mass Flight Cancellations
content: IndiGo has introduced new pilot allowances and raised some existing ones, in a sign India's largest airline is seeking to boost pilot morale weeks after mass flight cancellations linked to poor roster planning left passengers stranded.

title: Snowfall Forecast For Himachal Over Next 48 Hours As Tourists Swarm Hills
content: Tourist destinations across Himachal Pradesh are witnessing a heavy rush ahead of the New Year celebrations, even as the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecast snowfall and rain in many parts of the state over the next 48 hours.

title: Tamil Nadu Congress Chief Criticises 'Debt' Remark, Asserts DMK Alliance
content: Strongly criticising Congress leader Praveen Chakravarty's remarks on Tamil Nadu's debt situation, the party's state president K Selvaperunthagai on Monday clarified that his views don't represent the voice of the Congress party.

title: Odisha Man Forces Train Passengers To Chant Slogans, Show Aadhaar. Arrested
content: The Government Railway Police (GRP) arrested a man on charges of assaulting passengers and allegedly forcing them to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' and show their Aadhaar cards at Odisha's Balasore railway station, officials said on Monday.

title: Bangladesh Radical Group Asks Yunus To Cancel Work Permit Of Indians
content: The radical organisation Inqilab Mancha has asked Bangladesh's interim government to cancel the work permits of all Indians in the crisis-hit country, local media reported today.

title: India Gets 7 New Unicorns: Startups That Became Worth $1 Billion In 2025
content: India added seven new unicorns to its kitty this year. The startups that achieved the valuation of $1 billion in 2025 focus on artificial intelligence (AI), financial technology, consumer goods, and lifestyle.

title: NFL futures: Rams still Super Bowl favorites; 49ers close gap
content: Through 17 weeks of the NFL season, the  Los Angeles Rams  are the favorite to win the Super Bowl at +475. Right behind them are the  Seattle Seahawks  at +500. The  Denver Broncos  have the third-best odds to win the Super Bowl at +750. They are followed by the  New England Patriots  at +900. The  San Francisco 49ers  are next at +950 following their wild victory Sunday night. The Seahawks and 49ers meet in Week 18. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.

title: Grading coaching hires: Whittingham, Michigan agree to deal

title: The best of Indiana sports history: Stars, teams and moments
content: the INDIANA HOOSIERS are having a historic run this college football season . they went 13-0 in the regular season, staking their claim as the only undefeated team headed into the College Football Playoff . the Hoosiers will take on the Alabama Crimson Tide in this year's Rose Bowl on New Year's Day .

title: Ex-boxing champ Joshua hurt in crash, two killed
content: two passengers died in a car crash in his ancestral hometown of Sagamu . the two-time world heavyweight champion was traveling in the back of a Lexus SUV . he was transported to a specialist medical facility in Lagos and is in stable condition .

title: One stat that will make or break 2026 for all 15 NL teams
content: we're going to pick one stat from the 2025 season for each MLB team . we'll start with the national league and then return with the American League . 17 different pitchers recorded a save for the Diamondbacks .
